channel.title: Projects on WISS | Stuttgart Media University
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on WISS | Stuttgart Media University

item.title: FID Judaica
item.description:
FID Judaica

The “FID Judaica” is an expert information service (Fachinformationsdienst) for the domain of Jewish studies. This service is developed at the University Library Johann Christian Senckenberg in Frankfurt. WebIS takes care of the large-scale data integration and enrichment to contexualize the provided resources and to support innovative retrieval concepts.

Updates

March 1st, 2016

We are looking for a researcher to work with us in this project. Find more information here.

February 16th, 2016

The German press release is out:

https://www.hdm-stuttgart.de/view_news?ident=news20160126173433

item.title: InFoLiS II - Integration of research data and literature in the Social Sciences
item.description:
InFoLiS II - Integration of research data and literature in the Social Sciences

The InFoLiS follow-up project focuses on the identification of references to research data in publications in different languages and domains. To generate and provide the references, a sustainable LOD-infrastructure will be built.

For more and up-to-date information, please check our dedicates InFoLiS Website.

item.title: Springer LOD Pilot
item.description:
Springer LOD Pilot

The purpose of this project is to use Linked Open Data (LOD) to enrich Springer metadata and link them to other available data in the LOD cloud. The current implementation is making the data about conference proceedings published at Springer available as LOD.

Here is the link to the LOD Pilot.

item.title: JudaicaLink
item.description:
JudaicaLink

Scholarly reference works like encyclopediae, glossars, or catalogs function as guides to a scholarly domain and as anchor points and manifestations of scholarly work. On the web of Linked Data, they can take on a key function to interlink resources related to the described concepts. JudaicaLink provides support to publish and interlink existing reference works of the Jewish culture and history as Linked Data.

Here is the link to JudaicaLink.
